intro: Sisymbrium patens, commonly known as the field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant has alternate, pinnately divided leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruits are pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Sisymbrium patens is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
